task.title: Interview 101: Preparation is Key
task.shortdesc: This section provides essential steps to effectively prepare for your upcoming technical job interview, increasing your confidence and chances of success.

prereq.p: Before you begin preparing for your tech interview, ensure you have:

ul.li: Successfully scheduled an interview with the company.
A clear understanding of the interview format (e.g., technical screening, behavioral interview, coding challenge).

prereq.p: After the initial preparation, follow the steps below:

step.info: Visit the company's website to understand their mission, values, products, services, recent news, and company culture. Look at their social media presence and read employee reviews on platforms like Glassdoor. Understanding the company will help you tailor your answers.

Identify the key skills, qualifications, and responsibilities mentioned in the job description. Make a list of these requirements and think about specific examples from your experience that demonstrate your proficiency.

Practice answering standard behavioral questions like "Tell me about yourself," "Why are you interested in this role/company?", and "Tell me about a time you faced a challenge and how you overcame it." Use the STAR method (Situation, Task, Action, Result) to structure your answers.

cmd.b: Practice Technical Questions and Coding Challenges

step.info: If the role involves coding, practice solving algorithmic problems and data structure questions on platforms like LeetCode, HackerRank, or Codility. Review fundamental concepts related to the technologies mentioned in the job description. If it's a system design role, practice designing scalable systems for various scenarios.

Asking thoughtful questions demonstrates your engagement and genuine interest in the role. Prepare 2-3 questions related to the team, the projects you might be working on, the company culture, or opportunities for growth. Avoid asking questions that can easily be found online.

cmd.b: Gather Your Portfolio and Work Samples

step.info: If you have a portfolio of projects, code samples on GitHub, or other relevant work examples, have them readily accessible to share during the interview if the opportunity arises.

Choose professional attire that makes you feel confident and comfortable. For virtual interviews, ensure you have a stable internet connection, a quiet environment, and a professional background. Test your microphone and camera beforehand. For in-person interviews, plan your route and allow ample time to arrive early.

cmd.b: Review Your Resume and Cover Letter

step.info: Be thoroughly familiar with the content of your resume and cover letter. Be prepared to elaborate on any points mentioned and provide further details.
Practice your answers out loud, either to yourself or with a friend. Pay attention to your pace, clarity, and body language. For virtual interviews, maintain good eye contact with the camera.

taskbody.postreq: After your preparation, take a short break to clear your mind before the actual interview. Review your notes and the questions you plan to ask one last time.
